office: The Energy and Commerce Committee Democratic Staff
key_responsibilities: drafting news releases, social media posts, op-eds and talking points
designing graphics for both social media and web content
monitoring social media for trending topics
maintaining and updating press lists
compiling daily press clips
requirements: excellent written and oral communication skills
proven ability to perform under pressure while juggling multiple tasks
sound political judgment
Prior Hill or campaign communications experience
professional social media and digital experience (including graphic design and photo and video editing)

key_responsibilities: advising the Member on all matters in the issue portfolio
developing and advancing legislative proposals
analyzing legislation and drafting vote recommendations
drafting talking points for floor and committee proceedings
staffing the Member in relevant meetings
representing the Member before constituents and stakeholders
working closely with the Appropriations Director on handling Labor HHS Appropriations related work
requirements: advanced degree
experience in health care policy
experience advising a Member of Congress
experience advancing policy proposals
excellent written and verbal communication skills
enjoy working in a fast-paced, collaborative environment
Prior work in another Congressional or Senate office with Florida ties

key_responsibilities: Acts as the representative for the Congressman within their areas of responsibility including answering casework correspondence, meeting with constituents, and serving as a liaison with federal, district, and local agencies
Prepares periodic reports for the District Director and Chief of Staff on pending cases and district activities in their assigned issue areas
Continually screens active cases and acts as a liaison with constituents to ensure that their cases are handled in a responsive manner
Maintains up-to-date files on all cases and categories of information of importance to the office
Assesses casework for problems requiring legislative action and makes recommendations to the Legislative Director
Screens and refers cases, when appropriate, to other district offices
Staffing the Congressman at events in the district and serving as support staff for events put on by the office
Performs other duties as assigned
requirements: Thorough knowledge of local, state and federal agencies and departments
Knowledge of all issues and events in the district in which the Congressman is involved
Professional telephone manner
Ability to work cooperatively and courteously with others
Thoroughness and careful attention to detail
Ability to exercise discretion and independent judgment in fulfillment of casework responsibilities
willing to work a flexible schedule including some evenings and weekends

key_responsibilities: managing the incoming calls to both offices phone systems
assisting with District Office with constituent casework intake
assisting the Washington D.C. office with legislative work
staffing and managing the front office
answering the phone
greeting visitors
handling tour and flag requests
overseeing the internship program
occasionally driving the Member to and from events during regular office hours and afterhours
providing additional office support as needed
requirements: excellent oral and written communication skills
great attention to detail
strong time management skills
ability to work under pressure to meet tight deadlines
a sense of humor
Capitol Hill experience and/or Western ties
Proof of clean driving record

key_responsibilities: developing and executing a media strategy
writing press releases, talking points, and op-eds
managing the Member's social media pages
web site
pitching story ideas
working closely with reporters
requirements: on-the-record experience
strong writing skills
NY ties

key_responsibilities: drafting constituent letters
sorting and batching mail
assisting the legislative staff with various projects
requirements: strong conservative credentials
effective writing and research skills
attention to detail
ability to manage multiple tasks at once
Previous Capitol Hill experience

key_responsibilities: answering phones
maintaining the front office
assisting with various administrative and legislative duties
aiding constituents with federal casework
greeting constituents
ensuring that constituent requests for assistance are directed to the appropriate staff member in a timely manner
assisting district staff to ensure the proper execution of events and programs in the district
requirements: positive attitude
ability to work and set priorities in a fast-paced and challenging environment
Strong writing and verbal communications skills
valid California Driver License and automobile
Bilingual skills

key_responsibilities: communications planning and press strategy for D.C. and the district
drafting press materials including: remarks, talking points, newsletters, statements, press releases, and media advisories
pitching media events
assisting with the management of the Congresswoman’s social media accounts
interview preparation
overseeing the office’s franked mail and digital programs
requirements: strong writer
politically savvy
detail-oriented
flexible
creative
self-starter
Occasional travel to the district and non-traditional hours - including night and weekend work
Strong ties to New York press

key_responsibilities: managing the front office
answering, appropriately logging, and directing telephone calls
greeting visitors
monitoring office deliveries
distributing hard and electronic mail
other administrative duties
assisting district staff with constituent casework
constituent outreach
event scheduling, planning, and execution
constituent service duties
requirements: motivated self-starters
highly organized
detail-oriented
able to multitask
exceptional interpersonal skills
ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment
excellent “people skills”, displaying compassion in all interactions
strong commitment to providing outstanding constituent service
able to think on their feet
problem-solver
show keen attention to detail and an ability to multi-task
demonstrate excellent oral and written skills
maintain a positive demeanor
demonstrate resilience in a busy environment

office: The House Office of Diversity and Inclusion
key_responsibilities: leading data and research collection and analysis for the Office of Diversity and Inclusion
leading the development of the required diversity report
maintaining key metrics and key performance indicators for the Office
serving as a resource for external and internal diversity best practices

serving as the project manager for any consultants and/or contractors with whom the Office may engage to support the completion of the diversity report and to develop relevant diversity and inclusion-based training, in collaboration with the Congressional Staff Academy
assisting in the translation of research findings into materials that staff can effectively utilize in their engagements with Members and Member offices
providing research support on diversity and inclusion studies, techniques and tools
serving as project manager for the diversity report and, where necessary, direct and coordinate activities of external consultants
researching and studying best practices for retention and growth in House employing offices
leading data tracking and reporting with a focus on performance and results
preparing regular updates and briefing documents on research that is relevant to House employing offices
assisting with the development and delivery of training sessions and, as needed, conduct presentations at professional conferences and meetings
requirements: Master’s degree in social or behavioral sciences or related field; or equivalent level of experience providing technical assistance, data collections and/or research
knowledge and experience in diversity, equity, and inclusion research efforts, ideally with a strong background in curriculum development
Current working knowledge of coalition functioning, evaluation and research
Quantitative and qualitative evaluation and research skills
Expertise using relevant software
Customer-service orientation and ability to work harmoniously with a diverse team
Ability to work under deadline pressure and extra hours if needed on assignment
Demonstrated ability to self-motivate, initiate project activities, and work on multiple assignments simultaneously
Extensive computer skills, including data input

key_responsibilities: drafting legislation
writing hearing statements and legislative memos
preparing briefing materials
requirements: 3-5 years of experience, ideally 2-3 on the Hill
solid grasp of House procedures
deep understanding of relevant policy
Excellent writing, verbal and organizational skills
ability to be a self-starter while working in a fast-paced environment

key_responsibilities: None
requirements: minimum of 2 years’ experience managing a team
excellent oral and written communications skills
highly organized
meet deadlines
manage multiple projects
flexible schedule and ability to travel throughout the district
